Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but clean”
Reviews.Author: jesse1314
Reviews.Content: If flying into Rome to start a vaca this is a great place to stay, in the middle of everything you'll want to visit. After flying overnight we dropped our bags off saw the sites then crashed, room was very clean, nothing fancy, reminded me of college dorm room. Would recommend for 1-2 nights

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Bath_Rich
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milo really surpassed our expectations. After reading some other reviews I was slightly concerned that I may have made a mistake booking this place - I couldn't have been more wrong. It was extremely easy to find from Termini and in an excellent location for walking to all the major tourist attractions. The staff, especially those on reception were very helpful, and more than happy to advise on where to go and how to get there etc, always with a friendly Bonjourno or Ciao! The room was large with a compact bathroom, and cleaned daily with towels also changed daily. Our room had quaint shutters which opened up to view the bustling street below, although noise was kept to a minimum by the double glazing (apart from the singing Scottish rugby fans!). Breakfast was really good, OK it was basic cereals, pastries, cheese and meat with proper orange juice and coffee - your normal continental breakfast then. It was plentiful and certainly enough to start your day off well. The lift was small - big enough for two plus luggage, but the stairs weren't a problem. We realised on the last day that there was a lovely terrace where you could eat breakfast - will definitely remember next time! So to sum up, this is a fantastic value hotel in a really central location and I honestly don't think you could get much better - it is very highly recommended. I will definitely retrurn to this amazing and beautiful city and I will book in at the Milo!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JillieB652
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days (March) in Rome. Hotel Milo is perfectly situated for almost everything: transport, food, things to see. 8 or 9 steps lead to the lift taking you to reception. Breakfast was great (though not if you're wanting an unhealthy full British breakfast fry up! - we never found this anywhere). As they say - when in Rome, do as the romans do....have a light breakfast! Our room (308) was large and cool, as was the en suite. It was on quite a busy street, but the noise seemed to die down after 11ish (the double glazing was v effective) and most large cities are noisy. We were so tired after all the walking that we slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: panjegoli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a walking distance from the central termini metro station which is very convenient. The staff are nice. The breakfast is decent and the coffee is fantastic. There is restaurant close by called Pastaroma where we had the pasta there. The couple bed was made up from two single beds placed side by side and it was not that comfortable as the groove in the middle was kind of annoying. The rooms are clean enough. Overall it is good budget hotel with fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “location excellent, room terrible”
Reviews.Author: Steve186406
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in central Rome so great for seeing everything and the termini station is very close. shower was tiny and dirty as was the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, very clean”
Reviews.Author: chippy910
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last August during our first visit to Rome. Staff was accomidating, but certainly not overly friendly. Did speak very good English, so we had no problem there. Was very conveniently located, close to train station and close to some decent shops and restaurants. There was no air conditioning, but with the open window and fan, we were very comfortable. Room and bathroom were very basic but excpeptionally clean. I thought breakfast was great. It was the standard hotel breakfast that you will get in any hotel in italy- pastries, fruit, cereal, yogurt, juice and coffee. They also had a small terrace where you can eat breakfast and although the hotel is on a busy street, it was quite quiet on the terrace and very relaxing. The elevator was the only thing that was quite sketchy, so we just decided to hoof it and take the steps, which was totally fine. We loved this place, and thought for the price that we paid, we couldn't have found a better value. Will defitiely come back the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: minnee77
Reviews.Content: Here is a breakdown of my ratings: Service: The staff was very nice and helpful whenever we had questions. The elevator was broken the day we arrived and they offered to carry our bags to the 5th floor (though we didn't accept the offer... but we should have:)). Value: No add'l comments. Sleep Quality & Rooms: I would have given the rooms an average rating if there was air conditioning. The only reason we were upset about the A/C is because we were never aware of the fact that they didn't have AC. Rome has been unusually hot this September and we could not sleep during the evenings b/c of the heat and the noise from the street. Our room was facing a busy street and we had to keep the windows open to circulate the heat. I don't fault them for the noise on the street but for the fact that we had to leave the windows open. There was a small noisy fan to help circulate the heat as well. The bathrooms had no circulation so were always muggy and always had lots of condensation. Cleanliness: Very Clean Location: The location was great. The hotel was located approx 2 blocks from the central terminal of the metro, which is also where the train is located. We were able to get to all of the sites in minutes. This would be a great hotel in the Winter, Spring and Fall!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: nickjamesknight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights at the beginning of September. It is only a few minutes walk from the main train station in the city which also holds the biggest metro station inside of it. This metro station will take you to just about anywhere you want to go in the city including the Vatican City, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. Even closer to the hotel is the other main method of transport in the city (the tram) however we did not use this on our stay. When you arrive at the hotel you have to go down a wide alleyway and then turn left to a staircase. You have to up one short flight of stairs before you get to the lift which is in the centre of the staircase. You can take the lift up one floor to the hotel reception on the second floor. Our room was on the top sixth floor however the lift only goes up to the fifth so we had to climb a flight of stairs however this was not a major problem for us as it was only a few short steps. Our room was accessed through a door on the sixth floor that you must first press a buzzer to enter the next corridor as the building is shared with a few other hotels. The reception would then buzz you in. The room was a very good size with plenty of storage space for our luggage cases and other items. The wardrobe was a double one and had a large flat safe inside which there is no charge to use. We had a large mirror in the room also with a small fridge and a fan on the desk. The bathroom was nice and clean and although we never saw the maids the room was cleaned daily and we were given nice fresh towels. The shower was nice and spacious and there was a good supply of hot water. The breakfast area is located through the reception and it offers a good continental selection of croissants, pain au chocolate and cereals etc. There is also coffee, fruit juices and yogurts. The breakfast service runs from 07:30 until 09:30 which was early enough for us to have a good breakfast before heading on our various pre-booked tours. I believe that there is also a terrace to have breakfast outside however we never did this. Also in the area behind the reception there is computer and printer access for guests and a fridge with water and other various bottles of drinks that are cheaper than you would pay elsewhere so I found myself stocking up before heading out. On the way to the train station we found a small supermarket which had large bottles of Fanta, Coca-Cola etc for only 1 euro 50 which was a hell of a lot cheaper than the 4 euro that you pay at the tourist attractions. We will defiantly be going back to Rome again and we would definitely consider staying at this hotel again and would recommend it highly! The cleanliness, practicality, comfy beds and friendly staff are worthy of thanks and so was the free wifi provided by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “issues”
Reviews.Author: Rachel H
Reviews.Content: It was great to be near the Termini for our daily expeditions around Rome and beyond. The desk staff were accomodating.There were several issues, however. Breakfast did not begin unitl 0730. The room was not air conditioned, which is a definite issue in August. It fronted on a very loud street - at 0100 and 0600. The shower was small enough that one could accidently turn off the water mid-lathering.

Reviews.Title: “Europe trip”
Reviews.Author: Brooklynbarry
Reviews.Content: I could not believe that you have to pay extra for a/c in July. If the hotel has an a/c then it should be included in the price. What's next, charging for towels, soap, shampoo??? I have never been to a hotel who has an additional charge for a/c in the heat of the summer!! Do they have an additional charge in the winter to use the heat or do they just give you more matches to make heat???

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid.”
Reviews.Author: Tink025
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel of our entire trip in Europe. The receptionist was rude and abrupt on our arrival, and neither of us felt comfortable asking for help or advice about local sights during our stay. Air conditioning was an additional charge, and finding out the lift didn't go to our floor (we had to get out at the 5th floor and walk from there) was frustrating. Whilst the customer service was bad, the room was worse. The shower didn't drain properly, so you had to turn it off every couple of minutes so that the water didn't overflow. The nozzle was also broken, so it was like standing under a tap to shower. Breakfast was a dissapointment, as for example they only serve hot milk for cereal, and apart from croissants, the options were limited. Whilst it was at least clean, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, as I'm sure there are backpacker hostels of a better standard.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danvilera
Reviews.Content: FIsrt the location is awfull, ok it is near Roma Termini railway and subway station but the area is very ugly and feel unsafe... The hotel lobby is on a second floor, the elevator doesnt stop on the first floor, the hotel rooms are in the floors 3 and 5, the building is shared by 3 hotel and 1 hostal... the price is sooo expensive for what you get, breakfast is poor...

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: ezsfish
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find out you have to climb up to another floor to check in. Tough with luggage. The lift only accomodates two people without luggage. It was very hard to get the lift to your floor to use and we often used the stairs. Lights were out in different parts of the hotel at different times. Our first room had no a/c which made it very hot during the day but comfortable at night. We asked for a room with a/c and that cost us extra but worth the price. Thef first room was shabby but the second one was nicer. The third floor is much better than the fifth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tadamsRN
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy place by any means but it does the trick. The best way to explain it is that it's like staying at a B&B. It's small but has an elevator. The rooms are an adequate size and the bathroom was bigger than expected. You have to pay if you want air conditioning. They offer free wireless which was fantastic. It's less than a 5 min walk to the train station and we walked to all of the major sites without any problems. There are a ton of places near here to eat and shop. The staff is friendly. Breakfast is simple and nothing extraordinary but adequate. It was very clean and we enjoyed our stay here. Don't expect anything frilly or fancy. If you're simply looking for a place to stay while you tour rome that won't cost you a fortune-this is it.

Reviews.Title: “everything was good”
Reviews.Author: Vajakoni
Reviews.Content: lokation is greath. near hotel is termini railway station and metro station-2min walk, colloseum-15min walk, market -5min... i thing so that in hotel do not change towels evry day, hotel is clean. Staff is ok. You can take map of Rome at the table of reception.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back”
Reviews.Author: Rbris01
Reviews.Content: Absolutley brilliant stay the staff were great, a clean well appointed Hotel in the centre of Rome. I had a wonderfull stay breakfast, room, bed, TV and overall experience were fantastic. I based my stay on previous Tripadvisor reccomendations and the good ones were spot on, except you now get ham and salami with breakfast in the morning. Very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the Termini”
Reviews.Author: lizzieterry
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Milo Hotel, and would go back. The hotel is very close to the Termini, an is easy to find. It is located on 3 or 4 floors of a 6 storey building shared with 2 other hotels, but don't let that put you off as it is secure and well maintained. Breakfast is cereal, rolls, croissants and coffee-if you want tea, hope that Maria is working as she is really nice and prepares a tray with tea bags, lemon etc and a pot of hot water, the other girl said that they didn't do tea and didn't look happy when I produced my own tea bags and asked her to heat some water up-that said, she still brought us some hot water with a smile! The room we had was nice and clean and spacious, with a good en-suite and powerful hot shower. The TV signal was a bit hit and miss, and we didn't always get the one English channel (BBC World News) , but we didn't go to Rome to watch TV so it didn't really matter! The bed was comfy, but the double was two single mattresses on a double frame, so the middle was a big ridge :-( There was a small fridge in the room, which was really useful, and there is a mini market across the street if you need supplies. Watch out for the hotel tax-it clearly states at reception that this is payable in cash upon check-in, so when we weren't charged, we thought that it had been included with the initial booking. When we checked out, we were informed that we owed 2 Euros per person per night for the hotel tax, not a big deal, but the hotel should follow it's clearly stated policy and charge up front as is advertises. Despite it's central location, I didn't find it too noisy and was able to sleep each night. On the whole a good stay, and I would go back to this hotel. Rome is a beautiful city and we had a fantastic stay, this is our second short break in Rome and we will certainly be back for more Roman culture!

Reviews.Title: “A wet week in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mulberry25 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milo is well located for the railway station and being on a smaller road has minimal traffic, so relatively quiet. With numerous restaurants nearby eating out in the evening was a matter of choosing which one. Our one bugbear is the lack of attention to the importance for some of us of non-smoking rooms. The bedrooms are meant to be non-smoking though there are ash trays provided, but the corridor outside the bedroom was quite pungent on arrival. To their credit the staff took us seriously, but could not move us (hotel was full). The best we could do was open windows. This hotel does include breakfast which was fine, though coffee other than instant would have been much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ashcart Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the price and the location. It is very near to the main termini train station, infact it is literally over the road. Some tour books say the Termini area is a bit "dodgey" on a night time, but I have to say we never felt that at all. Yes there are people stood outside bars/restaurants but that is the same in any country. There are alot of people touting scarves and glasses etc..but again they leave you alone if you make it clear you are not interested. A few homeless people sleeping rough...but again, nothing we haven't seen before. Good restaurant directly underneath the hotel - Estelle or something like that...lovely food and good prices 18 euros for 3 courses. Hotel basic, but clean. Breakfast OK. Lots of bread and pastries...could do with some more fresh fruit or cold ham/cheeses as are often available in these types of hotels. Staff relatively friendly and helpfull. The road outside the hotel - we were in rooms 304 qnd 306 are VERY noisey, but just general traffic. Nothing that the hotel could do about it. Don't be conned by the touts for taxis at the airport. We paid 60 euros for a transfer to the hotel and the hotel quoted us the same price to go back.....we went to the Termini and got a white taxi for 40 euros....big saving when you are looking at a return ride...if you ask each driver the prices range from 40-45 euros. We went for a new mercedes that lloked clean and safe !!!!!!! Rome itself is all within walking distance of the hotel. We would book again......

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini station, good location & very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: nicnpappy
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The room was nice, clean and big enough for a family of 4 adults. The hotel is close to bus and train station and convenient if you get yourself a Roma pass which gives you unlimited free public transportation ride. Very close to Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. The staff are very friendly and very pleasant to talk. One more morning, we have to leave early around 7:15 am to go to Vatican, one of the staff offered and packed for us a generous amount of croissant and orange juice because breakfast room is not open until 7:30 am. This saved as some euros since we don't need to buy our beakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good trade off between price and quality”
Reviews.Author: MG2505 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The overall quality is good. Position is 5 minute walking distance from Termini Railway Station and Subway. Room and bathroom are large enough and clean, with in-room safe. Stairs might be disappointing since you have to climb half a floor to get to the elevator, and one floor more from the 5th to the 6th floor if your room is there. Breakfast is italian style, with croissant, bread, jams, juices, coffee, milk and not much more. Anyway it's good and abundant. We managed to get a very good price and so we were pretty happy with the overall quality. I guess it might be worse in summer, since air conditioning is available on charge and you will be pretty annoyed by street noise if you try to let the window open.

Reviews.Title: “Happy guests”
Reviews.Author: Maxerling
Reviews.Content: To the staff ot Hotel Milo Rome. Thank you for 7 wonderfull days at your cosy hotel, special thanks to Tony and Adriana in the breakfast room for their kind and exelent service. We vill be back some sunny day. Arrivederci e grazie Lise & Max Nielsen (Room 606)

Reviews.Title: “Location great, staff friendly and helpful, rooms adequate, air cond and clean”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie52
Reviews.Content: Had 3 nights at the Hotel Milo, and although it's upstairs - lugging suitcases in and out - it was a clean hotel, the breakfast was very good, and the staff helpful with us, being our first time in Rome. Clean and tidy rooms, air cond, not luxurious but very clean and more than adequately met our needs location-wise - close to train and bus station (only one block) and walking distance to nearly everything of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: O12345
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location. It is right by the main metro station and a 15 minute walk to the coliseum. We had a room that faced the main street where you enter. It is so noisy at night. You have to pay extra for air conditioning. So if you dont want to pay, and you sleep with the window open...be prepared for noise. You can hear garbage trucks all night long. The service in the hotel was good. Breakfast is ok, nothing special. The best thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Hme”
Reviews.Author: PatStevenson
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Milo on a 4 day break to Rome. Although the entrance to he hotel seemed a little bit dodgy I was quckly put at ease by the friendliness of the staff and he cleanliness of the service. The hotel has recently been completely refurbished and you can tell. The rooms were super clean and had all the amenities we needed (especially the air condittioning which helped wth the swealterig August sun. The bathroom was not the biggest but for the price we paid it more than sufficed. The breakfast though was the highlight with a selection f cheeses, cold meats, cornetto's (they are little buns not the ice cream :) ) coffee, cereal, fruit juice, fruit...the list goes on. Oh, and I almost forgot to mention they have free internet access. The hotel is family run and they made us feel part of the family.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience, centrally located, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Andrea42
Reviews.Content: I have read a few negative reviews for this hotel and I think they must be from people who expect a 5 star hotel on a 3 star budget. Yes, the hotel is not fancy, it's not large, it doesn't boast 120 English speaking TV channels, but it is clean and very well located for getting around Rome (just a couple of blocks from the Terminii) and for the middle of the summer the room price was extremely reasonable. I traveled with my husband and two children. We had one large room (as we requested) with 4 twin beds in it. We had plenty of room to move around and the beds were comfortable. We had a corner room with windows opening onto two very noisy (and fun!) streets. We could keep the windows open to enjoy the atmosphere or close them and not hear a thing. We also had AC which came in very handy due to the hot weather. The room charge also included a continental breakfast which kept us all going until lunchtime. All in all, for a budget hotel this was great. The staff were very friendly, giving us ideas on how to get around, which buses to catch etc. and we were within walking distance of all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Why did they put a 3 stars on this Hotel ???”
Reviews.Author: Feluriti
Reviews.Content: In the last 3 years i had the luck to travel all around the Europe and see almost important cities. I visit Rome from 06.08 to 09.08 and choose Milo, because it has a Central location. Indeed Milo is about 200 mts from Termini Station, so this is I think the only good thing. First if you arrive at night you feel a strange sensation, because the area around the Station, have all kind of people (if you know what I mean….) than when you arrive the Hotel you saw an entrance to a hall that gives you the access for several Hotels. If you tired, forget it, you have before at least ten steps of stairs to reach the elevator (max 3 persons) that will take you to the Reception on the 1º floor. The room (in my case for 4 people, me, my wife, and two sons) is something like basic. The aspect is not you expected in a 3 stars Hotel, something you feel that cleanness one of his aspects. I forget my slippers and at nights my feets are totally black. The space to have a bath is simply hilarious, because….as no space!!!, so you need to have imagination to spread shower gel in the body. And about the noise?. Yes, you have to be very tired to sleep, otherwise the noise from the surrounded bars and restaurants don´t give a chance. The breakfast was poor…poor…in all senses. The juices and yogurts are always hot, and you if you ask something to the lady you had a bad face in rewards. How could someone with a so good web page have a so poor service? After all, I will NOT recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For a central location at an affordable price, it'll have to do...”
Reviews.Author: blaqkgloss
Reviews.Content: We didn't have the best start as Booking.com neglected to specifiy to the hotel staff our request for two twin rooms, not two double rooms. However, the member of staff on the desk was very calm and negotiated with us one double and two singles instead. One thing I had an issue with was the hotel's idea of an incentive as giving us the remote for ONE air con unit for free... everyone else made do with an electric fan, which was ok if moved next to the bed but did little to cool the rest of the room. The elevator only goes up to the 5th floor and my room was on the 6th, and the room reeked of stale smoke. One thing I will commend the hotel for is the intercom and camera system to get onto each floor, which made me feel very safe. Hotel Milo is a very basic hotel but it is in a very central location and for the price I guess I can't complain too much- only stayed one night anyway... But unless you're really strapped for cash, avoid the breakfast and get it elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible Experience I Will Never Forget”
Reviews.Author: lucania
Reviews.Content: I spent one horrible night at this hotel in early May 2010 when I was stranded in Rome due to the ash from the Icelandic volcano. The emergency room locating service at the Rome airport placed me in the Hotel Milo as it is very near the main train station, and I was going to be taking the train the next day. They also arranged for a shuttle van to take me to the hotel. I arrived late in the evening after a long, stressful day being stranded in Paris, and, I was exhausted. I am a small woman traveling alone, wearing a back brace and carrying a cane. So, I was a bit vulnerable to begin with. Then I accidentally left my purse with my passport, wallet, driver's license, money, credit cards, and cell phone in the shuttle van. I only had a few Euro in my pocket. I was completely helpless at that point. There were two young foreign-born (not Italian) men working in the lobby area. One was at the desk, the other at the bar. I was the only customer in the lobby so they were not at all busy. Yet, they repeatedly refused to help me. They refused to call the police, refused to call the emergency room locating service at the Rome airport so the service could immediately notify the shuttle driver that my purse was in the van, and, refused to go with me to find a police officer outside. They made unacceptable excuses every time I pleaded with them for help. I was exhausted, in physical pain due to a bad back, and quite frightened. I could not think very clearly . I pleaded with them over and over again to help me for at least half an hour, but they would not. They said it was not the hotel's problem, it was mine. I told the one young man this is no way to treat a visitor to Italy. He replied, "It's not my country. I just work here." I asked him if this is the way women are treated in his native country? He would not make eye contact with me. I then said, "How would you like it if someone treated your mother, or sister, or daughter like this if she was traveling alone in a foreign country?" Again, he did not reply. I finally ran out of the hotel into the night to see if I could find a police officer . I crying and shrieking as I ran down the steps because by then I was in a panic, and ,these young men were so cold and indifferent. They almost seemed to enjoy seeing my vulnerability and suffering, and, this shocked and upset me as much as having lost my passport and money. On my way out ,I met the shuttle van driver who had discovered my purse in the van, and who was kindly returning it. The two hotel workers did not even help me take my luggage to the room. They saw my cane. They knew I was injured. But, they just stayed at the desk and watched me painfully struggling with it. They didn't show me how to work the old elevator, and, did not bother to show me the room, either. When I finally arrived at the floor, got off the elevator, and found my room, the light would not work and I was in the complete dark. I couldn't even find the phone. I began crying in frustration again. I had to go down the hall knocking on doors to wake up other guests to help me. Two other guests, Italian women, put on their bathrobes and came with me to my room to help me. The room was plain, but adequately appointed. It was clean. But, there was a lot of street noise outside all night long. It sounded like men were loading trucks. The noise kept me awake most of the night even with the window closed. I felt unsafe in this hotel, so I was eager to leave in the morning. I was hungry, but, I didn't even have the breakfast. I just wanted to get out of there. But, before I went, I asked a different desk clerk, an Italian man, to give me the name of the manager. He didn't want to give it to me. He kept stalling, asking me questions, and playing little mind games. When I told him the way I had been treated the night before, I realized that he had already heard the story from his two co-workers. He defended them saying, " It you wanted service you should have gone to a 4 star hotel." Before I left, I told him that when I return to the United States, I would tell the emergency room locating service at the Rome airport about this experience, and I would write hotel reviews to make sure that other people, especially women travelers, know the way guests are treated at this hotel. He said, "Go ahead, tell the President, too".

Reviews.Title: “very kind staff♡”
Reviews.Author: pyr1101
Reviews.Content: very kind staff, and close to termini St, coloseum, basilica, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: lu10
Reviews.Content: We spent one night Mar. 6 upon arrival in Rome before taking the train to Venice. This hotel is very close to Termini which makes it an excellent choice if you are catching an early train the next morning as we did. The hotel was easy to find with the hotel provided directions, different from our U.S. hotels in that it is mixed alternate floors with another hotel. Has an elevator after climbing steps to the reception area which was adequate for our needs. Room was very clean, triple with bath including small shower. Sufficient for our needs. The staff was friendly and made us feel welcome. Breakfast was included and was nice. We took a walking tour of Ancient Rome and walked to the Collosseum from the hotel. Took about 30 min. Had a problem with noisy guests in the middle of the night, called the desk and it was immediately taken care of. Appreciated the concern and attention of the staff to solve this quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lmh80
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay in this hotel, the hotel was very clean, price was great and the staff very friendly. Location is ideal 2 min walk from the station and just a short walk to lots of resturants. Very close to the Metro but also all the sights are in walking distance. Overall I would recommend staying in this hotel to anyone. Had a wonderful weekend xxx

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, clean but very basic hotel in easy to reach location”
Reviews.Author: pompeywanderer
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 5 minutes from the Roma Termini, located on the first floor of a busy street. We stayed with 2 teenagers in a quad room, which was of a fair size but basic. The bathroom was spotless, but shower cubicle tiny. Rooms were cleaned and towels changed each day. Complementary breakfast consisted of coffee, cereal and bread products - no hot option, but adequate to fill up before a morning out. Some street noise from about 6am, but nothing too annoying. A good location about 20 minutes from colloseum. Good restaurant around the corner from the hotel, Il Condor on Via Daniele Manin, doing a 3 course tourist menu for 10euro - not as bad as it seems - the food was very good and enough choice that you could go back a few nights - we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Adrian1725
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Milo for 5 nights over new year and found it to be excellent value and in a very good location just 2 minutes from Termini station. All rooms were at a premium price over this period but this hotel offered much better acommodation than anywhere else that we could find. The rooms are quite old fashioned and the decor is old but they are a generous size and have a good sized bathroom and excellent shower. I wouldn't advise this hotel if you have a disability as the lift is very small and you do have to walk up some stairs as well. The only other down side is it can get quite noisy at times as the Italians are rather fond of blowing their car horns a lot and the windows are not very soundproof. The reason this hotel stood out over others where I stayed in Rome is that the staff are very friendly, welcoming and also helpful. This level of service was sometimes lacking in Rome! I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget looking for a spacious room and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albanella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milo in September with a young family of 4, We had a very large clean and comfortable room. The bathroom was very clean however the shower was quite small. The hotel is part of a building that houses other B&Bs and only a very short walk from Termini station. You will need to carry your bags to the first floor in order to get the lift to reception. The continental breakfast was fine and plenty of it. The only time i would not recommend this hotel is in summer , as there is no air conditioning so you will need to sleep with the windows open and in Rome in can get quite noisy. Overall for the money we paid we got a very good clean and comfortable B&B I would recommend this hotel (not in summer) to anyone that is looking for a good clean budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel in a great position but don't attempt it in Summer”
Reviews.Author: JazzyRabbit
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here in mid August. The hotel is in close proximity to the Termini stations and also within walking distance to most monuments. As previously mentioned, be aware that you will have to climb 2 flights of stairs to get to the reception desk. The people at the front desk were welcoming and we were able to check into the room 2 hours early. The room was a a good size for Europe and also clean (room 506). The room opened onto Via Principe Amedeo and was very noise at night. This would have been overcome with air coniditioning but our room did not have any which in 40 degree heat was not tollerable at night. The bathroom was small (as are all bathrooms in Europe), but was clean which is ulimately what you want. The shower was very small and you turned the tap off each time you turned around in the shower. Breakfast was what we expected (and were not disappointed) - breads, meats, cheese, yoghurts, etc...... All in all a very basic, clean hotel (at the lower end of the 3 star rating). I would definately request a room with air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FlorenceLHongKong
Reviews.Content: Good location, near the Termini Station, easy to find, a good starting point for the Roma sight visiting, well equipped room with air-conditioning, small fridge, clean, good value for money, but the lift always out of order in the morning. the breakfast is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of a buzzing city”
Reviews.Author: ShaneandRose
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us a map and advised us on restaurants, transport and things to see. The room was large, quiet, warm, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good but the breakfast lady was abrupt and rude. Hotel Milo is close to station and shops, restaurants and cafes. All the main tourist spots were in walking distance. So immerse yourself in Italian food and culture. We were on the 5th floor and there was a lift which ran only between floors 2 and 4 - quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mobz11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel Milo for 2 nights and overall my stay was satisfactory. The hotel itself is basic and is located in a building which includes other 3 hotels. What is really good about this hotel is the rooms, they are not so small and are really clean with a very clean shower; however, you can hear a bit of noise from the streets, but frankly this was no problem for me. On the other side, the breakfast was poor, I skipped it on the second day and went to one of the nearby nice cafes. The location of the hotel is good (although the area is not the nicest in Rome) in terms that it is very close to all major transportation (main bus & train stations) which can take you to anywhere in the city at any time, but it is a bit far from the center which means that you can not walk to one of the famous piazzas. Overall, my stay was satisfactory as I was not expecting more from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, value for money”
Reviews.Author: DhanyaRenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights at Milo in end April. It was a reasonably comfortable hotel with spacious rooms. The location was close to Termini station so very central to everything. However, the reception is on the first floor and the hotel has a really small lift which was an inconvenience. The breakfast was also very basic. However, would say you get the value for the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware -- not what it's advertised”
Reviews.Author: KinWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel calls itself a three star hotel and it's nowhere close. Our experience started with a sign for the "elevator" that pointed to stairs. You have to carry your bags up a flight of stairs before you reach the elevator. The gentleman checking us in could barely be bothered with us. Not friendly or helpful at all. We went up to the first room he assigned us to, walked past the pealing wallpaper under the flourescent lights, and found that it had no air conditioning, despite their claims on all the booking sites that the property is airconditioned. We went down and compalined and he said he could give us an airconditioned room, but it was on the sixth floor where the elevator didn't reach. So more carrying of our bags up the stairs. In that room, we saw an airconditioner, but there was no way to turn it on. The guy at the desk refused to answer the phone, so we had to walk back down to the reception area where he gave us the remote control for the a/c which he had forgotten to give us before. As we waited for the room to cool down, I washed my hands an a sewage stench began to permeate the whole room. We covered the drain with a towel and didn't use the sink for the rest of our stay. We wanted to leave and find another hotel, but we were only there for one night and after all of the carrying of luggae and changing rooms, we didn't want to waste the rest of our evening looking for another hotel. Plus, I suspected the unhelpful gentleman at the front desk would not easliy agree to give us a refund. FYI, the staff members on duty later that night and the next morning were no more friendly. When I checked out, the woman never said a word to me. The only good news -- and the reason we booked at Hotel Milo in the first place -- is that it's very close to Termini train station. It's an easy two block walk. But i would never go back. There are so many hotels in that area. I have to believe you can find something better, even without spending more money.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: SaraBCKildare
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Milo Hotel for 3 nights. I found the hotel staff extremelly helpful and friendly. They have a map of Rome in the lobby, which is always really handy. The room was very clean and had a little mini fridge for your own drinks if you wished to have something cold. They also had a free safe, which is always a plus for peace of mind. The shower wasn't great but they gave you free little sandals to wear if you wanted to for hygienic purposes, which I found really cute given that I never like walking barefoot in places other than my own house. In summary, I would definitely recommend given that for the price and location, you are getting good value and I would certainly recommend Italy... I fell in love with the city... can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, close to Train Terminal and Historic Center of Town”
Reviews.Author: dane_the_dane
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a five minute walk from the Roma Termini, and a 10 minute downhill walk to the Colosseum, Roman Forum and other ancient sites. Perfect if you are taking the train into town or from the airport. We came in from Florence by train and took one of the twice an hour trains to the Rome Airport on the way out. The room was large, clean and had a tile floor. Bathroom is roomy with the cube shower that can be kinda tight. Breakfast was tasty and the staff friendly. A lot of other tourist hotels in the area, with restaurants abounding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: jacka30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only a few streets from Termini but I really wasn't concerned. The room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom was good too and there was a TV in the room. The staff were good. The restaurant next door Elettra was brilliant: the waiter spoke most languages and was very friendly; and the food was excellent. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault anything!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaQ
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 4 nights in Rome. I must say I read some reviews on here and was a bit put off(but had already booked!) but all I can say is some people are too fussy.You are not gonna get 5* for the price of a 3*. We were realistic and not disappointed at all!The main things we look for is clean (cleaners fantastic,always smiling and doing their best to chat and room was always immaculate!), comfortable (massive bed,power shower) and safe (area was nice enough,free safe in room,and you have to buzz in and out and leave your key). Location was fantastic for getting around, breakfast had a good choice and plenty of coffee! All in all for £40 per room a night I'd say this was a bargain! I haven't commented on Rome itself or restaurants etc but if anyone would like any info please feel free to contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: annabanannaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Very large and immaculately clean rooms. 5 minutes walk from Termini station. Breakfast is included: fresh rolls, ham, salami, yoghurt, juices and coffee. Safe in the room. Key has to be left with reception every time you leave the hotel. Not suitable for anyone in a wheelchair, as you need to climb one flight of stairs before you can access the lift. Very good value, and good security also. There is an internet cafe right across the street, and a laundrette next door. You can also buy hot pastas and pre-made salads from the Conad supermarket on the bottom level of Termini station. We bought a Carta Integrata Settimanale (16 euros) which allows you unlimited use of buses, trams and trains for one week.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RyanBand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before going on a cruise. Because of the cruise, we had 4 good sized luggage bags. The only negative was having to carry all four bags to the 2nd floor, because the elevator doesn't go to the ground floor. The people were very friendly and helpful. They gave us a map, showed us how to get to a few places we wanted to see, and even watched our bags for us for a few hours before our cab got there but after we'd checked out. In the morning there was a small breakfast that was nice. There's also an internet cafe right across the street, which was very convenient. If I was staying in Rome for more than a few nights and could afford it, I'd go with a more upscale hotel, but for one night of for someone traveling on a budget (as we were), Hotel Milo is great!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, perfectly placed hotel in central Rome.”
Reviews.Author: SkierBergen
Reviews.Content: About 200 meters from the Termini train station, do you find this very ok hotel for short stays. A little special that the reception is placed in th 2 floor, but no problems to find the way. The rooms was big and clean, had a small fridge and importantly, AC. We had to pay extra for the AC, 7Euros a day, but believe me it was worth it. Very nice Cafe just outside and across the street with prices almost half of the tourist places. Will definetly stay here again when we return to this fantastic city

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlapena
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milo is a nice, clean budget hotel. Breakfast provided was satisfactory. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. The proximity of the hotel to the Termini station and other shops, restaurants is excellent. We will definitely stay in this hotel again the next time we visit Rome. Thanks to all the staff for the good service provided during our short stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the cost”
Reviews.Author: karench14
Reviews.Content: It took a little time to find the hotel but once we did, we realized it was really close to the train station. I can see what other reviewers are talking about - if you are out at night and walking near the hotel, you can see some shady characters. But we were fine. We just kept walking and didn't talk to strangers. Once inside the hotel, you walk to the first floor and the reception desk. We really liked the guy who worked overnights - he knew us by the second night and was always helpful. We got early wake-up calls every morning. We were on the top floor and it was a serious hike to the top. There is an elevator but it's pretty small and we like to workout out so we tried walking it almost every time. Once on our floor, we had to push a buzzer for the receptionist to buzz us into our floor. The room we had was fine, #616. It included a double bed, desk, closet, and a desk fan. The shower is insanely small. I bumped my elbows while washing my hair many times - and I am pretty small! I can't imaginer a larger person being comfortable in there. The toilet flushed easily which was a plus considering all the difficult toilets we encountered throughout Italy. Looking for an internet place? They are everywhere. Next door to the hotel is a laundromat/internet place. A nice woman showed us how to get a password and then a 50 minute usage card from a vending machine. We did our laundry a few days later and the guy that worked there was....curt. He helped us but it seemed like one too many people had annoyed him that day! Note this place isn't affiliated with the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of the Colesseum, Trevi Fountain, and the Pantheon (highly recommended) so that was cool. My favorite pizza place was by the train station - Taglio Pizza - so simple but so good. I ate there 3 times in 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: dillinger
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights very close to railway station and bus and tube entry courtyard which is shared by other hotels a bit offputting but inside very nice and clean room, cleaned daily ,fresh towels staff very friendly and helpful couldn't fault it. but outside you must be aware of pickpockets as anywhere else.i think rome is a safe place compared to some other places. really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gringo472
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a two city tour of Italy, having arrived by train from Venice we were at Termini station, which is only a few minutes walk to the hotel, the area itself did seem a little dirty and seedy with alot of youngsters hanging around in large groups and street vendors selling sunglasses, bags and belts, although we weren't harrassed by anyone. The hotel was easy to find, which is good when you have suitcases to carry. The first impression of the hotel wasn't that good, as when you enter you are immediately in a dirty looking courtyard which housed the enterances to lots of hotels. Hotel Milo's reception was located on the first floor, and the receptionist was very friendly and helpful, and we quickly received the keys to our room on the sixth floor, which meant using the lift, which in itself is an experience, although I'm sure it's perfectly safe it made you feel a little uneasy. Once inside the room, it wasn't the most spacious room in the world but it was clean, had sufficient storage, had a TV with limited English language stations and a safe to keep your valuables in. The bathroom was clean, had a small shower cubicle and a bidet and sink, all in all no issues with the bathroom either. Breakfast was served in a room just behind the reception on the first floor, which having read other reviews must be new as the other reviews mentioned a cafe across the road, the breakfast itself was adequate, with cereal, coffee, croissants, yogurt and juices, all served in a clean environment. The location of the hotel is excellent with all the major bus, train and metro links you would need to access virtually any part of the city. If you are looking for a cheap, clean hotel with great transport links then this is an excellent choice as in my mind the hotel is really only a place to sleep as during the day you are busy sightseeing. If you want large rooms, satellite TV, big selection at breakfast and a better neighbourhood then look elsewhere. One small point to note is as all the floors in the hotel are tiled, you could be lying in bed at night and the noise of the other guests walking and talking is quite loud as the sound seems to echo, also when we stayed there was some building work going on, which meant drills and hammers making noise too, especially as they were starting work long before 9 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Good point are good, bad points are a slight concern!”
Reviews.Author: Welshlady84
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Rome and we stayed for 7 nights in hotel Milo. It was me age 22 and my sister age 18. Firstly we arrived at the airport and found a great company in arrivals called Terravision (don't be put of my the name) that transfer every housr to and from Ciampino to the Termini/station for aroud 8E each. It's about 40 minutes to the station. The hotel is Literally two street in front of the station and too the left so walking is not a problem, although BE WARNED the traffic is a nightmare, it’s a free for all so you have to walk out and dodge the cars like the locals…be careful. The hotel has a strange set up, you enter a courtyard and the reception is on the 1st floor and the rooms begin on the 3rd floor and there are other hotels on the 2nd and 4th floor, so they have a lift that is a nightmare for those afraid of small space and old mechanics I advise the stairs every time, but it’s not great if you have mobility problems! The receptionists were very helpful and speak moderate English and you can have air con for 5E a night which is in some way recommended as it’s so hot in July, although it’s too loud to have on at night so they provide the room with a fan, if you can cope I recommend saving the cash. The room is clean and spacious, with a free safe for your documents and cash and a huge full length window for watching the world go by. Also there is a hairdryer and empty fridge. The maids come in at around 10:30 and supply new linen and towels every other day. Breakfast is served across the street (with yellow umbrellas) until 10 o’clock, you get a pastry, toast, juice and a hot drink…in that temperature it’s just enough. They also have a great menu at night which is really cheap, no service charge, great waiters and it’s open 24hours…you can’t loose! Also down the road to the right there is a supermarket that sells big bottled water for 40c…great value….BUT all the water in Italy is drinkable, so fill up the bottles in the local fountains and save cash. The area is quite noisy also but it’s part of the ambience of Rome, so we ignored it. The small PROBLEMS: •We thought the are was good and pretty with a fabulous church in front of you and the Coliseum and Piazza Venetia a 5 minute walk down the road and the hotel is on a direct route for the shuttle buses, however we were told by our tour guide that the area was dangerous at night as it was a drug dealing and prostitution hot spot…not safe for young women to travel at night apparently…we didn’t notice a problem and we are only young so I suppose it’s something to keep in mind. •Pick pockets are a real problem, always keep your bags in front of you and don’t take out large amounts, and don’t look like a tourist!!!! •We also noticed that the bottom drawer of our cupboard had an envelope with adult material in it, so if you have children in a separate room, I recommend you check the drawers first. •If you like TV the only British/American channels are CNN and MTV international. We had a great time but for we noticed a few problems so we hope they help your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Footsie
Reviews.Content: We chose the Milo as we were flying into Ciampino Airport, the airport bus brought us into Roma Termini, and we wished to be located nearby so we could make use of Rome's Metro. Considering the reasonable room rates, the hotel was well placed for 'Ancient Rome', the Coliseum was around 15 minutes walk, and the Metro was 5 minutes away. Regular trains run to the Coliseum and the Vatican. The Hotel is unusual as it forms part of a large building which is divided into 4 hotels, and is spread over a number of floors. We were on the 6th (top floor), and our room was in the eves of the hotel, which gave it some character, and was away from the inevitable road noise. We found our room clean and a good size. I agree with other reviewers that it would benefit from a 'Spring Clean', but generally the room and Hotel were satisfactory and good value for money. The Hotel would not suit you if you are less mobile as the lift does not go down to the ground floor. The lift itself is quaint and old-fashioned with opening wrought-iron doors. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast in a Cafe across the road was fine. Overall the Hotel was much as we had expected and we would use the Milo again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was quite disspointed with this accommodation. While it was close to Rome train station, it seemed to be in quite a dodgy area of town. The courtyard that you entered the hotel from was very dirty with lots or rubbish on the ground. The hotel staff were nice enough and the room big enough, but it was not particularly clean and the air conditioning was noisy and could not be kept on at night because of the sound, which made for a stuffy room. Additionally it cost an extra 5 euro a night for air conditioning. The hotel provide breakfast at the cafe across the street, which is basic but fine, croissant, toast and coffee. It seemed a lot of school groups were staying at the hotel as well, perhaps this is the type of hotel which suits that type of traveller, but it wasn't what my husband and I were looking for. I definatley would not recommend staying here, unless you are a budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: viv2367b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milo during a 3 day stay in Rome. The rooms were very clean and the hotel is very close (3 blocks away) from the Termini Station, so it is easy to get around Rome to most of the tourist attractions and get to the airport (FCO). The staff there was very helpful and speak fluent English and German. They gave us good recommendations for local restaurants. They included breakfast daily at a nearby cafe with OJ and hot chocolate or capuccino and crossaints. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again! I would recommend you try to get a corner room as these are MUCH larger than the regular doubles. We found a good price off of easyjethotels, but I'd recommend looking at venere and other sites as well.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: AName
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milo during the Easter holidays (2006) and would not return again. The locations is very convenient for access (train station 3 mins walk) and whilst the area is a little run down, we felt safe walking there at night. The main problems we had: - During our stay there was no hot water on floors 5 and 6. We had to use a room on a lower floor to shower (when it was free). No chane of moving rooms - The lights in the room didn’t work and the person on the desk didn’t seem to care. Eventually he came up and used tape to fix the light. - On Sunday night we returned to the hotel at 1.30am and the hotel was closed !!! It took 30 minutes to gain access by knocking on lots of doors / doorbells and finally we woke up the night clerk. He told us the hotel normally closes at 1am - The staff were unhelpful. - Bathroom was dirty, with mould, etc. But other rooms we saw were clean and nice. - No fresh towels provided - The staff didnt seem to care - Lots of noise - but that's a typical Roman problem, so cant blame hotel for that - It was bad value for money - 150 euro per night for a twin room I can see that this could have been a reasonable place to stay IF (a) price was better and (b) there was no water/light/dirt problems. I wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price and the service its perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very nice staff, helpfull, clean room, very clean bathroom, i enjoyed every minute of my stay. They knew i would leave the next morning, and even though the treatment was as if i was a guest who stayed far longer, Milo, my compliments!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots Of Character”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a large family room for a week at the hottest time of the year. Three good beds, plenty of room, sat tv, very good safe and ample bathroom with shower, bidet, basin and wc. Very clean. A fridge would have been excellent. Located about 5 minutes walk from Termini Station in an area full of other budget hotels and restaurants. Take no notice of guidebooks especially the British ones that say this is not a very nice area. Everyone we met was friendly and provided you don't stagger around waving your wallet or handbag in the air you should be fine. We would definitely stay here again. The entrance lobby looks rather shabby which is a pity because once you get beyond this area everything is fine. So don't panic when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judith51
Reviews.Content: The courtyard into the hotel was very deceiving and wondered what we had come to! However, once at reception, staff were very obliging and remained so throughout our stay. We were on the fifth floor which was very high and the lift was an experience. The room was very large with plenty of storage space for luggage etc. The bed linen was changed every day as were the towels, (however don't expect nice fluffy towels - they were basic cotton/linen type) and the room was cleaned every day. A lovely experience going across the road on a morning for breakfast which consisted of coffee, orange juice, toast and croissants which was ample and kept us going till lunch time. Used the same restaurant for our evening meal as it was very reasonably price. Had to leave passports etc in hotel safe as there was no safety deposit box in the rooms. An adequate hotel and based centrally.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good value basic hotel. Most importantly for us were that the rooms and bathroom were invitingly clean. Down side was that the days were hot and room was not airconditioned forcing us to keep the windows open which let in a lot of street noise. The breakfast across the road was very ordinary, but the key plus was the convenient location to the termini for catching the public transport. A good place if all you are looking for is a clean bed to crash after a big day of sightseeing.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Milo
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 76, 00185 Rome, Italy
